sn35.242:0.3: 242. The Simile of the Tree Trunk (2nd)
sn35.242:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimibilā on the bank of the Ganges river.
sn35.242:1.2: Seeing a large tree trunk being carried along by the current,
sn35.242:1.4: “Mendicants, do you see that large tree trunk being carried along by the current of the Ganges river?”
sn35.242:1.6: When this was said, Venerable Kimbila said to the Buddha:
sn35.242:1.7: “But sir, what’s the near shore and what’s the far shore? What’s sinking in the middle? What’s getting stranded on high ground? What’s getting taken by humans or non-humans? What’s getting caught up in a whirlpool? And what’s rotting away?” …
sn35.242:1.9: It’s when a mendicant has committed the kind of corrupt offense from which there is no rehabilitation.
